p: Similar results were obtained by Bolarinwa et al. [ 91], who added Moringa oleifera seed powder to bakery products, increasing the protein value from 8.55 to 13.46%, ash from 0.63 to 1.76%, lipids from 7.31 to 15.75%, fibre from 0.08 to 0.62%, vitamin A from 50 to 74%, with a reduction in moisture from 22.9% to 20.01% and carbohydrates from 57.68% to 46.73%, also highlighting the increase in calcium, iron, phosphorus, and potassium in all its breads. Sensory evaluation results indicated that bread enriched with 5% Moringa oleifera seeds was not significantly different from the 100% wheat flour control [ 91].
